posts.text:
This is something I have thought of just recently. For good to exist, bad must also exist. If bad doesn’t co exist, then good cannot exist because there would be nothing to compare it to to give it value. It would just be neutral. Therefore for one to exist, the other must also be in existence.

This reminds me of a quote from Nicholas Sparks’s ‘A Walk to Remember’  ‘Jamie: Without suffering there would be no compassion.’ 
If suffering did not exist there would be no one to be compassionate to. In life if bad things don’t happen then we wouldn’t know the value of good and happy moments. Days would past, time would fly and we would never get a glimpse of how truly beautiful life could be with happy moments and good times; it would all simple be neutral or ‘normal’. 
^_^ This post was inspired by my friend S.D. who pointed out the fact to me, that if bad does not exist then good cannot exist! :D

Butterflies are my favourite creature and this is not due to their beautiful appearance alone; this is due to their nature.Butterflies usually originates from caterpillars who spend this time span feeding. Sometime after, the caterpillar will go through a transition period into a cocoon to become a butterfly. When it becomes a butterfly, it begins the mating period which has now become easy for them as they have formed their colorful beings to become attractive to draw attention to male butterflies. Due to the butterfly’s delicate nature, once it mates, it is damaged and begins the countdown to it’s last days.However, it fights til their offspring can survive on it’s on then it dies. Butterflies are not just what you see, there is more to them and they have more to come. Their past wasn’t always like what they are, and their future wasn’t set to be perfect but to the butterflies this is their way of life and they have embraced it. My word to you today is that your future and your past shouldn’t define you,  it should be what’s in the present and how you do it to the benefit of you and being considerate to others involved in it as well.

-Kari
Life itself can’t give you joy unless you really will it; life just gives you time and space, it’s up to you to fill it!! =D

There comes a time when our childish things will be looked down on by society and we are faced with the concept of developing a sense of responsibility and maturity. To most people we will be forced to give up something we quite enjoy because it’s ‘childish’. To some, it will be a dramatic life change and it will be a challenge to face but here’s something you shouldn’t forget, your soul would be as young as you want it to be and you don’t have to change because you think you don’t fit in. Your youth is what makes you the amazing person you are and your many dreams that follow with it is what makes your life worth living.  Let your youth be your guide *along with your brain too* because your life has only just begun once it’s your guide :) Your youthful soul is the most glamourous part of you! :)

-Kari

At some point in time we all wonder ‘how to get better days’ . We always hear the saying ‘ you have to change your own situation, it won’t change itself’ and we often wonder ‘ what can I do to change my situation?’ Changing our situation does not have to involve long tedious tasks or hard work and sacrifice. It can be the littlest of actions that will make us feel better. Sometimes a simple deed can lead to big change. So don’t get scared by the idea of making your days a bit better; start with tiny changes and see the difference it makes. Don’t doubt the little actions; even the tiniest change can make a big difference.

xoxo :D <3

As people, we have to rely on  something to survive which most often becomes our source of survival which is a job. In order to get a job sometimes we need some qualifications which leads people to the path of earning their degrees. In these steps to life, along that way, we may meet someone who can change our lives entirely. They can be your new source for survival,  your new reason to be better and they can also be your greatest weakness. They too may be following the steps of life to survive it which makes it difficult to drop everything for you. Keep in mind that this isnt a bad thing. It may feel challenging and it will make the heart more fonder but, it will also thread the courses of distance and show the true nature of what it really means to you. Nothing great ever came easy and distance is only the beginning not the end……have a little faith :)

-Kari

Some people think that you need a lot to make yourself happy but the truth of the matter is, you actually don’t! Happiness is a state where you feel joy in an extreme way and this could come from anything. In my personal view, this comes from a good crowd. Your friends. Not the one’s you barely feel comfortable with you know, but the one’s who makes it okay to be your crazy self. These friends accept you for who you are and they tend to always keep things genuine. My words to you this morning,  surround yourself with good people that understand you. You deserve to be happy!  :)

-Kari

Everyone has days where everything seems to go wrongly.

Sometimes our days are filled with chaos, mishaps, and inanity because of one little negative thought in the morning. ( I know what you’re thinking…’ seriously? one  thought can’t mess up an entire day, pssshh’) Believe me, it can and it happens! By waking up in the morning and thinking to yourself ‘ ughh, I don’t wanna get up today! ‘ , you are already creating a mindset of negativity for the day. If your first thought for the day is negative, then it creates greater space for negative thinking and an attraction for adversity that day. You will notice all the nonsense that happen in your life and you will actually attract chaos.

So on waking in the morning, instead of starting your day with a simple negative thought that will mostly likely result in a day of difficulty and annoyance, begin with a positive thought! The first step to having a better day, which is the simplest way to achieve peace and contentment in your day is to begin with a positive thought, for thoughts lead to actions.  ^_^

Be positive and stay happy! =)
xoxo <3

An exhilarating experience to have is those vast feelings where your heart takes you to new heights and you think you can’t possibly love anymore than you already do but your mind and soul does otherwise! With this introduction, I don’t want to make this a typical love post but perhaps an encourager yet a reminder to some people out there. Love is a powerful thing and its especially enticing when you can love someone who loves you just as much (and probably even more! ) and to have this experience, it is truly amazing. What I’d like to say is that to the people who have some significant other in their lives, to truly cherish them and to the one’s who have created the mental block against love, there are more complex issues that could use that stronghold but, love shouldn’t be one of them. Love is truly an experience that will stay with you for a long time. So for those who have been blessed with such an opportunity and to the ones who have it yet to come, remember these simple words, ‘cherish,love,protect and be honest to the one you love always :)  *thank yew nr (::)*

-Kari

“People tend to think that happiness is a stroke of luck, something that will descend like fine weather if you’re fortunate. But happiness is the result of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly.”
~ Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat, Pray, Love.

Everyone can achieve happiness, ease, peace, and betterment in their lives. The only difference between someone who is happy and who is not is that the one who is happy is able to see pass the misery in their days and find the happiness even if it means working for it. It is not something that we will automatically wake up in the morning and find, however if we have the right mindset, it will not be hard to find either. Its is not rare, we just need to see through the distress in our lives and find what is worth living for. When we find the very reason why we suffer these horrendous days, we have found happiness. The reason you keep going and continue to strive is your form of happiness.

So find your reason to live, work for it and you will find happiness! ^_^

xoxo :D

We all have dreams. Dreams bigger than ourselves. Dreams we are too scared to even think about because it seems impossible. But its not impossible, in fact it is very much possible. But you must be determined. You must be determined to achieve what you want, and be the best at it.  You have to want it more than anything else, always strive at it, always trying, always rising when you fall ( yes you are going to fall but thats no reason to give up). You must be willing to risk things, willing to sacrifice. You must be so determined that no one will be able to diminish your dreams, not even yourself! You can’t let your own thoughts get in your way, you have to tell negative thoughts to sit down and shut the hell up. Even when it seems impossible you have to be so determined that you still try your hardest.

^_^  xoxo :D

Big things often have small beginnings...it’s probably one the biggest cliches you ever heard in life.

But it’s that damn truth! Everything that exists, was once an idea. It wasn’t made into a big success at first try!

The biggest companies today was once a mere sole trader business…the most successful person was once a person with a dream….A dream to be successful…a dream to follow that dreams! Wecan’t sit here thinking ‘well, i’m really not like that person so better not try’. If you’re saying that, smack yourself in the face and shut up * just kidding don’t hurt yourself :D * But the truth is, we really can’t sit here doing nothing and expect to be successful one day. We can’t expect our dreams to magically fall into place or appear in front of us one day. We have to get up, get out and get going. We have to try and make our own dreams come true. Ain’t nobody gonna make our dreams come true for us…we have to do that ourselves! We have to follow our own dreams. We have to take the risks involved in achieving our goals. And if it seems impossible, we have to make it possible! Make it exist if it doesn’t exist. Invent it! We have to try harder than ever and make sacrifices. Give up on people who bring us down…surround ourselves with people who lift us up. We have to do everything it takes to achieve our goals. And we must try our best, and be the best we can :D :D :D ^_^ 

xoxo, love <3 :)

Do what makes you *HAPPY*

Be with who makes you *SMILE*

Laugh as much as you *BREATH*

Love as long as you *LIVE*

<3 <3 *that's just my little sprinkle of happiness into your life for today :D :D*

So i always get these awesome, crazy ideas such as going bungee jumping, deep sea diving, getting a job ( yes, getting a job is on the same page as bungee jumping for me) but somehow these never make it pass the ‘idea stage’. They always remain in the idea stage…suffer…and die…r.i.p. 

This is because the ‘actually doing it stage’ is usually barred by fears….fears of trying and failing. The fear of starting something and failing is usually the main cause of people (me) quitting or not even trying at all! Sometimes (all the time for me) we tend to forget that first we must start at the bottom of the ladder and climb to the top. For some reason we expect to grow wings and fly to the top in a matter of seconds but when that don’t happen, we get disappointed and quit. If results aren’t seen right away, we automatically think we failed and we should stop trying. But guess what… ROME WASN’T BUILD IN A DAY!!  …it wasn’t wasn’t build in a week…it wasn’t build in a month! …It took YEARS!! 

 
Sometimes things won’t go the way we expect, but it’s all part of the process. Sometimes it goes better but sometimes it becomes worst. When it becomes worst, this is not the time to give up, its the time to work harder and try even more. It’s not going to happen in a spit second. Whatever it is you are doing or thinking about doing, you will have to complete all of the stages before achieving success. You need to climb the ladder, one step a a time…even if it’s one step a day; the main thing is that you reached further than you were yesterday. 
 
ROME WASN’T BUILD IN A DAY. Don’t give up, keep trying and you may need to take a step back sometimes and change your method of climbing, but if it gets you further to goal in the end, then it’s completely worth it! ^_^

~Stay Happy…Keep Trying~

It’s not easy to accept the things that happened in the past, especially if it’s painful, but it really is the only thing you can do about it. You can’t change it. So accept it as it is…learn from it…and move on. Don’t let it just be forgotten either. Learn from the mistakes. Now you know what not to do. :D :D

Don’t follow the crowd. Don’t conform to society. Be different. Be you! Don’t let society tell you what to do or become. Live the life you love (unless it involves harming other people, don’t let your life affect others negatively). Become who you want to become. Don’t let society limit you, confine you or tell you your dreams are too big. It doesn’t matter how big your dreams are, you can definitely achieve them. Be different and follow your dreams.

You have reached this far…you can reach further! Just take it one day at a time…one second, then minute, hour, then day. Just Keep Going. You went through today. You will make make it through tomorrow and you can make it even better.

Seems to me like a chance to start all over. To develop new habits…or achieve just about anything you want to. What does it mean to you? Feel free to let us know :)

xoxo :D ^_^

Kari here! :) Hi guys, it’s been a while since I’ve posted (my sincere apologies) but, I won’t let that happen :) I believe the last time I posted would have been (goes back to my last post to confirm the date) about 7 months ago. In this time frame a lot has happened and I don’t think my blog space will allow me to share every detail but I will nevertheless attempt to summarize these events quite nicely and short:

I wondered what the purpose was of bad things happening to good people. I spent endless days speculating that if I was a bad person and if this was part of the bargain that bad people had to endure. I came to realise that it was essential for growth to occur. I learnt that if I was to move on to a stage in life that I had to face a trial and learn to deal with it. I learnt that how I dealt with the situation determined if I was a mature individual or if I was still stuck in the child like mind. I was engrossed to decisions if I was to continue filling my heart with pain or to accept the outcomes that life provides and to go through the procedure. I had to grow up. There were some points where I asked myself “Why should I accept these changes why can’t I be resilient?” That was when I came to terms of dealing with the pain. I didn’t see the point if I was to cry and break everyday. I didn’t want to be depressed. I didn’t have the time to be susceptible to the pain. I had too many expectations to live up to. People relied on me and I relied on myself to keep going.  I learnt in that moment, I had to make myself happy, that others couldn’t do it. They could be the source but not the actual will. The will had to come from me. I controlled my feelings. I eventually grew up.

 

I hope this inspires at least one person to see their purpose and wills :)

-Kari

‘Only when the last tree has died and the last river been poisoned and the last fish been caught will we realize we cannot eat money’

Happy Earth Day!! (even though it’s a little late) :)

However, I think that Earth day should be considered as everyday because we live on Earth everyday. Some people may underestimate the impact that our simple everyday actions can have on the planet. Recycling may seem like a waste of time and it’s better to purchase new than to reuse the old stuff…but seriously guys, one day we will use out all of the Earth’s natural resources and and pollute the environment so much that the entire Earth becomes a toxic waste dump. We will only then know the true value of the resources we had. Also, while simple actions may seem as though it can cause no harm, a build up of these simplicities can definitely lead to to a bigger issue and have a huge and detrimental impact on the environment. So let’s try to protect our lovely planet by appreciating the wonderful natural resources and let us try to not contaminate them and destroy.

*If you think you do not have a big enough impact on this planet to care…Here’s a list of simple actions that are harmful to the environment:

- purchasing bottles water very often and throwing away the bottles because they usually end up in landfill

-simple littering on the streets, in a drain, on a savannah or anywhere possible because the garbage would evetually end up clogging the drains and causing floodings

-wasting water in ways such as leaving the tap on while you brush your teeth, soap your skin and shampoo your hair

-leaving on the lights or anything that uses electricity because you are wasting very valuable energy which usually result in cutting down trees to make more energy

- cutting down a tree or plants that could have prevented

- using chemical fertilizers and pesticides because after they soak into the soil, they run off into the drains, rivers and seas

-breaking of coral reefs to keep as souvenirs

 

*But you think these are a part of everyday life and you need them for survival? Here are some ways you can alter you habits and contribute to the protection and preservation of the environment:

-having one refillable water bottle so you don’t dump hundreds of water bottles every year

-wait until you reach home to throw your garbage away or use a public bin…if you’re at the beach carry a garbage bag and take it home

-close the pipes while brushing your teeth and shampooing hair and soaping your skin

-turn of lights, fan, or unnecessary electrical items when not in use

-plant a tree or plants if you have a backyard or any piece of dirt that could sustain a plant

-use environmentally friendly ways to prevents pests

-take a picture of coral reefs but do not break them of, they are vital for ocean life

 

So it’s not so hard to just recycle a little or stop yourself contributing to unnecessary harmful environmental acts. In fact most negative environmental issues are caused for humans. YOU and I can stop this by starting with ourselves to make a difference. We can make a change!

*REDUCE* REUSE* RECYCLE*  :D :D :) ^_^

Sometimes we tend to take things for granted. We tend to believe that we are unfortunate because we do not possess a whole lot a money or other material items such as a big house, a fancy car, a swimming pool in our backyard. We feel as though we’re not blessed or we are suffering. Our days seem endless and the hour seems to go on forever as we spend most days in work or school and our bosses or teachers continue to be a pain.

We sit around and wonder when or if something good will happen to us. When will a miracle happen. But it has happened…and it is happening everyday…even at this moment as we breath!

There are many tiny things in life around us that are miracles but we are too caught up in thinking about how bad our day will be or was so we don’t notice. Many of the things we take for granted each day is a miracle and is beautiful and we should be thankful for them.

Think about it. Think about the things in your life that you are thankful for. Anything. There is no wrong answer. Here are a few of the ‘tiny’ miracles that I have received in my life:

-my wonderful family (even though they may be hard to deal with at times)
-friends that I love
-a house to return to everyday after work
-food to eat that keeps me alive
-the lovely trees that surround us that supply us with oxygen
-the pretty flowers that can make a dull day just tad bit more bright
-wifi (no explanation needed there lol)
-water to keep me hydrated
-chocolate which makes me feel better

Those are just a very few. Think about what miracles that have occurred in your life and what you are very thankful for even though they seem trivial. Nothing is too trivial to list. So think hard about the tiny miracles in your life and list a few in the comments for us. We look forward to seeing what your tiny miracles are :) ^_^

Trapped in this world
Losing her mind

No one but herself!
I feel sorry for her because her life is a mess

This was my attempt at writing a poem :p Tell me how I did…hope i did well :)

Dark grey clouds filled the sky denying the city of sunshine. The gloomy atmosphere brought with it many annoyed faces as most people stood under bus stop sheds or stayed inside stores and waited to spot a taxi. But not my friends and I. No. We boldly walked out onto sidewalk and decided we will walk home on this Friday evening (without umbrellas). However, don’t get me wrong; we are not brave people. We were worried. We were very worried that the rain would soak us before we reach home. But nevertheless, we continued to walk ourselves home (mainly because we couldn’t get a taxi). So here we are…walking…with a few people doing the same in front us, when suddenly, thunder roared. Tiny droplets of rain began to drizzle. One of the girls in front spun around and yelled ‘rain is coming, ruuuunnnnn!’ We all burst out in laughter. It was hilarious! We took off, full speed ahead, running up the sidewalk trying to outrun the rain. Obviously we didn’t make it. The rain started pouring down on us. But there was nowhere to stop; we had to continue walking through the shower.

However, we found it quite enjoyable. Even though we were dripping wet, we began making jokes and playing in the rain. We decided that we cannot let a little rain spoil our Friday evening. So we started singing, yelling, laughing and doing all sorts of silly stuff. We did not allow the rain that we worried so badly about to stop us from reaching home on time or enjoying our afternoon. In fact, that was one of the most memorable and exciting times we ever had while heading home. It was the rain that filled the afternoon with such joy and amusement.

So sometimes in life we spend all day and night worrying about an issue. But it makes no sense. We need to live for today. If a little or a lot of rain begins to pour in our lives, we need to get out there and dance in it! We need to make the best of every situation. Even when we it can be the worst thing that can happen, it can turn around to actually be the best. We could have stayed under a bus stop shed and waited for the rain to pass, but then we would not have had those fun times.

You need to do that in your life also. Come out from under the bus stop shed and play in the rain. We need to see the best in a situation and make every moment an enjoyable one. Life is not about waiting for the storm to pass, it’s about learning to dance in the rain. Sometimes it’s the times that we fear most that can turn out to be the best times…only if we make it happen.

xoxo <3

Sometimes we may wonder… ‘why do I have to experience such hard times in my life? Why do such bad things happen to me all the time? I didn’t ask for it, I did nothing wrong!’

Is it because the universe hates you?
Is it because God hates you?
Is it because people hate you?

But no…no one hates you! Sometimes its because they love you.

Every situation in life that we experience happens because we need to grow. Everything that happens to us, happens so that we can grow from it…the good AND the bad as well. We need to expand our perspectives on life, we need to become stronger and we need to know what it’s like to face difficulties and challenges. We need to learn how to depend solely on ourselves. Difficult times teach us how to deal with those situations in case they may occur again or in case something worse may happen. Sometimes we fall in order to know how to rise again. Sometimes we fail in order to know how to be humble. Sometimes we lose in order to know how to be content.
Just because something bad happened, doesn’t mean it’s for a bad reason. Sometimes it is to teach us a lesson. Sometimes it’s so we can prepare for something worse in the future. Sometime it’s to show us where our weaknesses lie so we can mend it and become stronger.
In every situation in life, there is a lesson to be learnt. Think hard and find out what triggered your break down, that’s where you weak spot lies. Find your weakness, grow from the situation and learn how to deal with your weakness.  :)
~Learn from Situations…Grow for Them…Stay Happy~

((This is a part two of a note I posted recently. If you haven’t read the first part, then you should read it before you read this post because you may get confused….or at least read the first paragraph of part one.
Here’s the link to part one –>  http://aminellie.wordpress.com/2014/04/26/playing-in-the-rain  )) :)

 

Every morning as the magnificent sun rises above the horizon and blesses the world with its presence, so do new challenges.  Everyday a challenge awaits us. Whether it is as simple as waking up on time or as heart wrenching as death of a love one; there will never be a day without a challenge. Many of these situations we may be prepared for due to similar issues faced in the past or advice given to us by others. However, a great deal of life’s challenges will pop up so unexpectedly that they can scare the living daylights out of us. Sometimes situations occur but we will be so completely unprepared for them that we will be worried out of our minds. Situations that we are unprepared for will happen but we cannot hide from them. This is not something that can be avoided. We cannot choose if they occur in our lives or not. However we can definitely chose how they affect our lives.

We can either let them completely disrupt us, or we can continue to go on.  We can worry about it so much that we spent most of our time worrying.  We can search for a solution so much that we spend most of our time searching. We would spend so much time searching for a solution that the situation would have passed without us realizing.  But we can’t do that. We can’t let these challenges affect us so badly. We have to continue to go on…through these hard times…through the rain. Even if it seems impossible to endure, we have to hold faith in ourselves and believe we can do it.

If my friends and I chose to wait until the rain passed, we would have never arrived home on time. If we chose to wait on a taxi, a taxi may have never come. But we chose to walk through the rain even though we had no umbrellas. We were completely unprepared for this task but we had to endure it anyway. We did not let the rain delay our lives, but we continued on as usual.

This is what you need to do in your life. When the rain falls in your life, you need to walk through the rain and still arrive on time. You can’t let life’s challenges get in your way. You have to get up every day and endure these hard times and never let it disrupt your life. You need to hold on to hope and handle these situations with such courage that you might not even think that you were unprepared.

So if you are experiencing hard times at this moment, don’t let it consume another moment. Get up now and don’t let it deter you from doing what you have to do. Don’t let it delay you from living. Even though you may be unprepared when situations occur, do not let that stop you. Continue to go on…walk through the rain…conquer these challenges with faith, hope and courage!

xoxo  ^_^ <3

Live…Be happy…Smile
A scene from the movie Kal Ho Naa Ho

 

Kal ho naa ho. This phrase, ‘kal ho naa ho’ is the name of a very touching, beautiful, Indian movie and it means ‘tomorrow may not be.’ It is definitely one of my favourite quotes. (It’s an Indian film but it was based in American and if you haven’t seen it then you need to watch it!)

We can never know exactly when our life will end. We put ourselves into so many life threatening situations each day. Our simple daily activities can go wrong in many ways. The world is full of obstacles that can result in death of a loved one or ourselves. However, this is not a reason to lock yourself up forever and conceal yourself from life’s challenges because then your life ends automatically. What we need to do is get up, push our problems aside and begin to fully accept life. Forget all of the issues that held you back; forget all of the people that say you can’t; forget all of the pains and worries you carry on your shoulder. You do not need to carry the worries of the world in your heart. It is not up to you to handle the world’s problems. But it is up to you to live and enjoy your life. It is up to you fill your days with laughter and smiles. It is up to you to out meaning to the little time we have on Earth. You need to be so full of joy that you can no longer feel pain. You should be so cheerful that your face begins to glow with happiness. You should radiate show much love and charm that others feel happy just by seeing you. Tomorrow may not be so you need to get up now and conquer your fears. Learn how to smile again if you forgot. Learn how to live; how to be happy.

Live…be happy…smile…tomorrow may not be…kal ho naa ho.

Xoxo J

As the month of April comes to an end and the first third of the year has already passed, let us take a moment to look back at our experiences. We may have had some beautiful days while others were not so good. The best days of our lives so far may have happened during that time but also the worst. Friends we will keep for a lifetime may have entered our lives in those months. Maybe those days will be the fascinating stories we tell our future generations; or maybe those are the times we want to burn our memories and lock out of our hearts.

There may have been days where you felt pain, anger, frustration, hatred, sorrow, grief and depression. Perhaps this was the fault of a relative or close friend. It could have been someone whom never thought would hurt you that caused you immense pain. These situations happen to the best us and we can choose to carry those memories forever or to kick the person out of our lives. You can choose any option you think is most satisfying to you in dealing with such issues.

But what you have to do is forgive. In any solution you adopt for this issue, forgiveness must be a part of it. You need to forgive that person, not because they need forgiveness or a second chance, but because you need peace. In fact you deserve peace. The only way to achieve peace is to let those thoughts go. In letting go, you must forgive. When you forgive someone, you are saying that no matter how bad they hurt you, you are able to release those thoughts from within. You will no longer feel pain. Those thoughts will have no place in your mind and will inevitably desert you. The weights of those memories will no longer be on your shoulders and you will begin to feel a difference. You will feel that the person is no longer an issue in your life and you simply will not care. Even if you see that person you not be reminded of those hard times. This is because you have forgiven that person. That is peace.

So think about those who have hurt you for those few months and forgive them. Let those memories escape you mind forever. Feel the peace that you deserve. So your task for the upcoming month is to release all grudges from your heart and mind, forgive, and let us know how that goes for you.

xoxo,  we wish you best of luck and countless blessings in your life for the month of May. <3

It’s that time of the year again…exam time.A lot of people (who go to school) have final exams soon or in process right now. And almost everyone complain about having having. They don’t know how to study, don’t know what to study, don’t know how to begin, to distracted to study, too bored or tired to study and sooo much more endless complaints. But despite all those excuses, studying really is not that hard. Here are a few tips on studying for those finals…or cramming two weeks before the exams:

1) POSITIVE MINDSET- I think this might be the most important. Instead of saying ‘uurghh why me, I gonna fail anyway, it’s too late,’ try telling yourself that you can do it. Tell yourself that you have enough time to cram and you will learn everything, you will study everything, you will understand the work and you will pass!! Even if you think you are completely hopeless, still keep a positive mindset. It will make you feel as though there is still hope and you can still study and pass.

2) GET A SYLLABUS – Get the syllabus that was outlined for the course you are doing. If a syllabus is not available, get the general topics you are supposed to study. This will help you because you will know exactly what you are supposed to have learned and you can study from that.

3) GET NOTES- Get notes on allllll the topics that were supposed to be covered during the course. If you don’t have notes form classes, use google (yahoo or those that no one knows about…whatever browser you use), or ask a friend.

4) HIGHLIGHT- read through the notes and highlight or underline all the main points and important information.

5) RE WRITE – Write over all the important notes you have in your own words. This will help you in understanding the work and remembering. Get examples for everything. Use current examples form your society.

6) MAKE CRAM NOTES – Get sheets of paper (printing paper not those with lines) and make notes on all the important topics. Write main points and important information. You should use only one sheet of paper per topic.

7) DISCUSS- Discuss the topics with someone not doing the subject and who is completely clueless. Explain the work to that person. This will help because in explaining the work to someone else, you be ensuring that you understand it also. They may ask questions that are relevant for your understanding and that may even come in the exams. Also they may give their point to view, examples and criticisms.

8) CHARTS- Make charts of your important notes and stick them on your bedroom walls. Comparisons can be put on a chart. Also diagrams; if you are studying for example the human body, then you can draw the systems and parts on diagrams and stick it up. If you are studying society, poverty mas can be useful…etc.

9)CONCEPT/ MIND MAPS – Do concept maps. First you begin by writing the topic, then the main points and then link the main points to other points. This is what a concept map looks like: 

 

You can make it all colourful and interesting if you like.

10) BRAINSTORMING- Get a sheet of paper, write the topic and then just write anything and everything that comes to mind about the topic.

11) TAKE BREAKS – Take breaks after you studying a topic. About 10 minutes break should be enough. Or if you can’t sit for long periods, study for 15 minutes then take a five mutes break. Your breaks should not be longer than the study session.

12) EAT FIRST- Do not attempt to study on an empty stomach. IT does not work. Get something good to eat first but do not overeat.

13) SLEEP- Get enough sleep. DO NOT pull all nighters. This is the worst thing ever. You need sleep to be able to formulate and retain the information in your brain.

14) WRITE LISTS – Write lists of the topics you are going to cover for the day. Then when you do them, cross them out. This will give you a goal and keep you focussed throughout the day.

Sooo…this is my simple compilation of tips on studying. Hope this helps you study and pass all those exams. If you try any of these, tell us if they work…also if you have any that you’d like to share, tell us in he comments…and if you’d like to expand, then feel free :D :D

If this help you in any way, share it with someone you know who needs it…via social media, email, speech, print it and give it someone, or any other way you’d like. :) :)

Having the time of your life…living life to the fullest…yolo. So whenever I hear these sayings I always tend to think that to have the time of your life you should be partying hard and hanging out all day with friends, buying tons of frivolous stuff and just living a really laid back lifestyle. Do you ever get that picture in your mind when you hear those types of sayings??

Well…to be honest, you don’t. You need to be partying all night and drinking and hanging out all day to live life to the fullest. In any situation you are in, you can enjoy life. You can have the time of your lives in the most awkward situations. Those times where you least expect to have fun, can be the best times of your life…only if you are able to make it so.

My friends and I were completely not expecting to have so much fun that day. But it was awessommeee. Who would think that walking home soaking wet in rain would be fun? Those were actually one of the best days we ever had while walking home and it really was a wonderful time. The trick to it though, was that we could have complained and looked for shelter, but we chose not to. We decided that it would be cool to just run through the rain and play in it. We made that choice to make that drag situation a cheerful and joyous time.

So although we were not partying, drinking, hanging out or any of that sorts, we still had the time of our lives that day. Simply because we made a dreadful rainy day into fun day. So you don’t need to spend tons of money and do extravagant stuff to have an fulfilled life. You just need to make everyday and every single situation count. Even though it may seem lame, it could actually be a really fun time but only if you choose to do so. YOU have to make fun times in every situation you encounter.

Hey guys…I figured out a really really easy way to get wavy or curly hair. NO HEAT NEEDED :D

So first of all, you just need to wash your hair as usual…with shampoo and conditioner. Towel dry for a few seconds until it’s a bit dry. Let it air dry, but while it is still a little damp apply oil or moisturizer or whatever product you use in your hair. Then plait you hair into one simple plait (while it’s still slightly damp). Leave it for the day or the night. I usually do it in the night. Then when you’re ready, loose your hair from the plait and wallaaaaaaa…now you have wavy hair. *angels sing, heaven’s light shines*

If you want it really curly, you can plait your hair into more plaits and plait it tighter and smaller.

It looks really really nice and it’s almost effortless!! :) :D
You guys should definitely try it…tell me in the comments if it works for you and what you think about it :D <3 …send me a pic via facebook too  ^_^

Do you have fears? Don’t lie to me…of course you have fears. EVERYONE HAS FEARS. One of the main fears people have are of what society thinks. Very often before we make a decision or take on a task we ask ourselves ”what will people think, will they laugh, will they scold?” We even ask our friends to justify what we’re about to do. We need justification from our friends to know if it will seem  ‘okay’ or  ‘acceptable’ by society. If people don’t like it then we divert our actions into something else…something people will like. This is because we like feeling accepted by society, we enjoy the praise we get from following the crowd. But are we really doing what WE want to do? Or are we doing what society wants us to do? We are living in accordance to what others think because we are afraid. We are afraid that if we do something different we will be shunned.

Is that really living? Is confining our true selves and concealing it from the world really living? Are we getting the real essence of life when we do this? When we live by what others want to see because we are scared to show who we really are…is that living? If you think it is, what kind of life is that? The enjoyment you feel is not from within. It is determined by external factors and therefore it will fade. The joy from being accepted for doing what society wants in not joy that will last. Living by the fear that people will neglect because you do something different is not living at all. You will begin to live when you get rid of those fears. When you burn all the fears on what society will think, is when you will begin to feel the true joy of life.

 

HOWEVER – This does not mean it is okay to commit violent acts. Being different does not refer to violence or crime. It refers to showing your true personality and your different culture……as long as it is not harming anyone else or scarring them. Just saying.

What are you afraid of showing to society? What do you hold back inside? What mask do you wear everyday??

But more importantly…what mask are you going to burn today? What true colours are you going to show? What joys of life are you going to experience? Tell me…I wanna know. :D

Why do some people feel the need to shame others on social media? Is that satisfying? Well it must be…seeing someone you hate being laughed at online…must be gold. But embarrassing someone online is destroying their image. The whole world can see it! Everyone has access to this information! Their bosses, friends, family…everyone! While this may seem funny to you, because I’m sure you’d love it if that person loses their job or gets kicked out of school, this is a very disgusting and immature way to get back at someone or to resolve an issue. If something is bothering you about that person or if they hurt you in any way possible, you do not need to destroy their image. The whole world doesn’t need to know this information. Do you know the amount of consequences this can have? MUCH!

This can also be harmful to YOU! Yes you. You never know if a situation can come around and you need that person’s help…suppose you need to ask for a favour? One day, you may be in need and that person may have the exact thing you need and now you have to ask for the favour. But you post will always be on the internet…it will be there to haunt you and that person forever. The whole world will remember it (well at least those who saw it). You can’t get away, can’t forget.

Also, how immature is that? Bashing someone on the internet! Are you a child? Please grow up and learn some decency. There are better ways to solve an issue that putting it on the internet. You can go to them in PRIVATE and talk it over. If you feel threatened, then go with people. Talk gently, apologize, or just choose to stay away from that person.

Or…if you have a grudge against someone and you want to post it on the internet, at least do not post their name. Don’t tell the world who that person is. We don’t want to know!!!!! I cannot stress on how annoying it is to see someone post something about a private matter and bashing the person on social media. HOW DOES THAT HELP THE ISSUE??? Please tell me, I would like to know!! It only makes things worst!

This is rant with a purpose. Please absorb some information into our brains and stop bashing people directly on social media. Thank You!

If someone bashes you on social media, be the mature individual and not respond in the same matter. It’s as easy as breathing to reply with disrespectful comments, cursing, sending them to hell, cursing their family etc. But don’t. Don’t reply in that way, because it will lead that person to reply again and then you will reply again and then they will reply again and it will go on for so long with the both of you forgetting the cause of the issue and just cursing and arguing.

Instead, go to their inbox and reply there. Ask what the matter is. Apologize. Say anything! …but in the inbox or on chat or email, anything that is private. Even better, see them in person! Deal with the issue like an adult please. Grow up. Don’t continue this immature cycle of putting their business out their and then they putting yours until you both say everything you know about each other. STOP THAT CRAP!

Next time someone tries to shame you on social media, reply with a private message or show up at their house…(only if you can defend yourself and you have a good reason to though, don’t show up at their house and get beaten up).

What is Hope? 

Hope is that tiny light you see at the end of the tunnel
Hope is that little voice in your head at says ‘maybe if’
Hope is that whisper of ‘try again tomorrow’
Hope is when you are exhausted but you keep going
Hope is when there is no visible way to succeeding but you still try
Hope is that feeling of excitement when you think you prepared well
Hope is taking on the task when you know you didn’t prepare at all
Hope is walking along the path no one has ever walked on and expecting to find something new
Hope is the teeny weeny feeling that there is something right when you have strong feelings that everything is wrong
Hope is holding on to withering strand of thread instead of letting go

Hope in this sense may seem ridiculous. But having hope also accompanies and produces courage, bravery and endurance. Hope is for everyone. The irony in hope is that those who are weak tend to be more dependent on hope and may even have more hope for their lives than anyone else but having hope, in itself, is strength. To have hope is to keep going when you want to give up and this is pure bravery and strength.

What do you think hope is? :)

Hope sees the invisible, Feel the intangible and Achieves the impossible.
When you have hope you are automatically opening the doors to success. You are able to see beyond the chaos of today and still believe that you can withstand it and overcome it. In having hope you may seem ‘ridiculous’ or ‘fantasitical’ to some, but you are really opening your mind to the wonders and new possibilities of the world. You are adopting a positive attitude and continuing to go through the pains of this world and still see a brighter future. You will achieve this brighter future because you will be able to see the light when you believe the light is there. You will make a brighter situation from all challenges life gives and inevitably you will make it through the pain.

Have hope that you will make it :)

A lot of the pain we are dealing with are really only THOUGHTS. When a difficulty occur we tend to let it consume us. We spend every waking second worrying about it and at night we’re up crying.

When something happens and we spend all our time thinking about it, it will eventually begin to overtake us…we will not be able to think clearly or function properly. This is because we open ourselves up to our problems. We become vulnerable. Most of the issues in our lives are not more than a simple dilemma but because we think about it so often it begins to be the only thing on our minds. We begin to worry more than we should and create situations that are not even there! Hence, much of the pain we feel are merely thoughts. Thoughts that we let overcome us and now they seem like huge problems.

Sometimes we think about situations for too long and worry so much that when the thought enters our mind we are the ones that keep it in there. Maybe we could have solved the issue a while ago but because we became to worrisome and vulnerable that now it seems unfixable. Maybe we are the cause for some of our pain because we didn’t kill it when it occurred but we let it penetrate our minds and now it seems like it lives in us.

Therefore the pain we feel is the pain that lives in our mind because we let our problems crawl into our mind and seize our thoughts.

Many times, thoughts can disguise themselves as serious and chronic emotional pain and invade our minds. Sometimes we the ones that cause this because we entertain these thoughts in our minds for so long that they begin to grow. They make their abode in our minds and slowly commence in stealing our peace and overtaking our minds. But how do we when our pain are really only thoughts?

First we must look at the pain itself. What cause the pain? Why do we feel sad or depressed? Is there even a reason? Many times we don’t even know why we feel pain! It seems as though it just appeared and we don’t even know the cause. If we don’t know the cause of the pain then why are we feeling pain? There must be a cause but the cause may not be apparent. This is because we let the feelings reside with us for so long that we don’t even know why we feel sad anymore; we just feel pain. If we are able to find a specific reason for our pain then we must know the issue. Is the issue still occurring? Did it happen in the past? If it was something that happened in the past then it is evident that the distress from that issue crept into our minds and we let it stay there. We let it form itself into a permanent mark of the issue which develops into permanent pain.

When we put of plans because we have a lot on our minds, when we can’t enjoy anything because we constantly feel perturbed, when we find ourselves drifting back to the thoughts that cause the pain such as the issue, when our minds feel stuffed and our thoughts overwhelm us…that is when we know our pain are just only thoughts.

If today was a hard today for you or is still a hard day, always remember there will be another chance tomorrow and today will end. No matter how many challenges you encounter today, it will end. You will have a chance to do better tomorrow. You will have a chance to evaluate your actions and be able to point out ways to handle the challenges better and then apply these lessons to tomorrow’s challenges. End today with a smile because what whatever you encountered, you endured and you are still alive. Therefore you are strong, you are brave and you have the capability of withstanding your hardships and overcoming them. So end your days with a positive thought of beating your challenges tomorrow and do not continue to stress over the troubles of today because it will end.

Speak about your blessings more that you speak about your problems. You will eventually begin to find yourself feeling more grateful as you choose to recognize your blessings rather than your problems. When you focus on the good things in life you will automatically feel happier. The brighter side of situations will be more apparent to you. When you ignore your problems they will eventually begin to lessen because you are focusing your attention on the good things. The problems you experience will diminish and as you put all of your attention on the blessings, your mind will notice more blessings every day, even the tiny ones. So speak less of your problems and let them take the back seat in your life and focus all attention on the blessings. Speak of your blessings often and train yourself to notice the blessings in every day life; you will be filled with gratitude, contentment, satisfaction and happiness. :)

Many of the things that happen to us in life have an underlying lesson. It may not be apparent and it may seem quite trivial for such a huge matter. But it is a lesson that may come in handy at some point in time. Our experiences in life can teach us many things that we may not have learnt if until we experienced them. They can actually prepare us for tougher times in the future.

Your issues may seem purposeless right now and they may feel burdensome but there is an underlying lesson. Whether it be the ability to overcome such (or worst) situations faster, learning how to react or learning how to prepare for it, it is a lesson and you will gain something. You may gain the ability to help others through similar issues, the ability to fight off these problems or the ability to ignore these issues. Whatever you learn may actually be off use to you in the future and you will then be thankful that you had previous experiences that shaped you.

Many of these situations will continue to occur until you’ve learnt your lesson. Until you learn how to overcome them or how to avoid them, they will obviously continue to happen. Therefore you must gain the lesson of the situation before it ends and apply to your future situations.

So look at the challenges in your life and find the lesson. Find the lesson, learn it and keep it in mind so you can use it again and you will be able to overcome or avoid the problem in the future :) :)

In life, change is inevitable. Everything must and will change. To be able to adapt to new surroundings we must evolve. To be able to progress in society we must change. For development to occur, we must change.

Change however, is not something we are very fond of. We like our lives the way it is. We like having control of what happens to us and when change occurs we feel vulnerable. We feel vulnerable because we may not have as much control of our lives as we did before. We may even hit our lowest point. But we must be able to accept change. If we continue to run away from and avoid change we will be doing more harm than good to ourselves. So when change occurs in your life, do not despair. Do not hope for a better life or a life without change. Do not crumble. Hold on, because change usually brings development, progress,  and evolving and adapting to new lifestyles and environments. Change will occur when there is betterment ahead for you. So hold on tight, close your eyes and believe. Believe that this change in your life is for the better. :)

What changes have occurred in your life recently? What betterment has it brought? What change is occurring right now?

Just remember in situations such as these that, ‘this is just the beginning of a new start’ So whatever it may be that you are bidding farewell to, always keep in mind that it’s not the end…just the beginning :)

If you want to get different results you must do something different. Doing the same thing continuously will give you the same results. If you want to find happiness, peace, satisfaction and contentment, you must do actions that bring about those results.

If your life right now is troublesome or hectic then you mus do something differently. Change around your lifestyle a bit. It does not have to be definite and big changes but instead it can be little tiny changes in regular actions. Reacting differently to a situation will give you different results. You know how you react to situations and issues in your life and you know the results it brings. You must then choose if these are the results you want and this is life you wish to continue living or not. If you want to turn your life around and live in more positive environment with happiness and joy you must change your actions and reactions and adopt habits that will give you the life you want. Every time a situation occurs ask yourself if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future. Choose the best choice; the choice where you change the way your react and act for a better future.

You need to change the way to react to situations to change your future. Be a pioneer of your future by choosing to change your old habits and adopting habits that will shape a future of progress, betterment and happiness.

Do you want to be a pioneer of the future of prisoner of the past? What changes are you going to make or have made already?

Many times we find ourselves thinking ‘that person is a good example of the cause of the world’s problems’ or ‘why do that person change themselves, the world don’t need anymore of them’ or ‘just wait here, other people will do it’. But do we ever think that we are the ones who need to change? No. We always find a way to put the blame on someone else.

But how can you wish for others to change and not change yourself? If you want a more peaceful world, do not wish for others to change but instead change yourself. Be a more peaceful person and the world will be one more person towards peace than it ever was! If you want to protect the environment, do not wish for others to stop littering but instead adopt habits that will aid in protecting the environment and the world will be protected by one more person than it ever was! If you see a problem with something do not wish for others to solve the problem or change themselves. You be the one to solve the problem and begin by changing yourself. You must be the change you wish to see in the world- Mahatma Gandhi. Do not be blinded by your laziness or fears, get up now and change the habits you have that are contrary to the change you want to see in the world.

Stop blaming others for the world being as it is if you are saying others will fix the problem. If you are doing nothing to solve the problem either and continue living with your destructive habits then you are part of the world’s problem!! Nothing will change if everyone sit there and say that others will change it, others are the cause and others need to change themselves. Furthermore, you cannot want others to change and you not wanting to change.

If there is something specific you want to see in the world such as peace, love and humanity, you need to be that change.

What do you wish to see in the world? And what ways do you think you can change? :)

My last three posts were based on the topic of change but do we really know when to change? When is the time to change your ways?

First we must establish goals. Look at your life right now. Take a few minutes and write down a few of your habits, daily routines, beliefs, norms. Then look into the future; what would you like to achieve in the future? Where do you want to see yourself? What do you want your life to be like? Then write those points down; also write what habits you want to adopt and what you want your daily life to look like. Now do some research if you have no idea how to achieve those goals. Research on how to achieve and what it’s like achieving and also how people’s life have turned out after they achieved those goals. Also research the daily routines, habits, norms and lifestyle of people who have achieved that life.

Now look at your habits and ask yourself if any of these habits coincide with achieving your goals. If the answer is no, then you know it is the time to change. You must change those habits that do not help you reach your goals. The habits that deter you from achieving your goals must go.

How to change is whole a different story. You must look at the habits you want to change and one by one let them disappear. Stop letting them grow; starve them instead. Then also slowly adopt new habits in place of the old habits. This will take a while but it is worth reaching your goals.

What old habits deter you from achieving you goals? Do you think it’s time to change?

Opportunities always come to us and we think ‘ this is the wrong time, I’m not prepared at all.’ We always end up blowing off chances to do something we always wanted. Why? Because of fear. We’re always too scared that we may hurt ourselves. Scared that we may break our hearts, or be scarred for life. 

While it is sensible to think about the future and protect yourself from being hurt, sometimes it’s worth a risk. Years from now we may be more disappointed by the opportunities that we let pass by than by taking the risk and getting hurt. We’ll always have the doubts and regrets in the back of our minds that taking those chances could have changed our lives. Pain and hurt from taking a risk can be eased and it would have been a lesson for future situations but we’ll always think ‘ maybe if i took the chance I would be in a different situation now, might even be a better situation!’Don’t be  afraid to take chances, sometimes it will be better in the future to take a chance than to always be in doubt, wondering how your life would have changed. Moving on from hurt and pain isn’t easy but living with regrets and doubts is harder.

So generally perspective means the general attitude about something or the point of view on it. It is the way you look at a situation and interpret it; the way your mind understands something and what it makes of it.

Our perspective on life is usually determined by experiences. We tend to hold past times in our mind and judge present and future situations based on those experiences. The way we interpret situations is not entirely out of free will; our intial or first impression or a situation is based on something from the past that has similar qualities.

Take this for an example: when you were little you fell of something high such as a wall or your gallery. Now you may be afraid of heights because everytime you get close to the edge of a tall wall or building those memories from your past will surface. You will remember it and you will continue to be afraid.

Therefore we are not entirely using free will to decipher situations. We are trapped. We are trapped in our own minds; being devoured by our own memories. They haunt us and they define how we view the world. Our past experiences are there to guide; they are not entirely a destructive device. They are there to warn us; or to let us know what may lie ahead. We use our past experiences to base our perspectives on because we need a guide so that we would not end up in a state of confusion or ignorance.

However, we must be careful in what we base our perspectives on life on. Life is not something that is constant and therefore change will occur. Our experiences is not a definite answer to what lies ahead and what we should view a situation as. Sometimes when your experiences surface for you to use as a guide in a new situation, you must brush it aside and take up a new view of things. View things differently; treat things differently. Sometimes you must dare to ignore the past and try something different or something your experiences tell you you can’t do.

Do you remember a time where everything seemed wrong and you felt more alone than ever? A time where you were drenched in sadness and consumed with loneliness? A time where your life fell apart?

Did you struggle to put the pieces back together? Do you remember who helped you? Who was your last hope? Who stood with you through the hardships, the stress and the pain? Who was your last hope; the only one would you could have turned to or the one who saved you? Was it yourself or someone else?

You don’t forget the face of the person who was your last hope ~ Katniss Everdeen.  If you haven’t communicated with the person recently, think about giving a call or a facebook message or something. Thank them. They at least deserve some bit of thanks. Open your eyes and realized who was your last hope; the person who saved or and helped you.

We have at least crashed once in our lives and it claimed to be an unbearable time to cope with. You sometimes may have felt like letting go or loosing yourself in the mild darkness that you felt. Broken, sadness and every negative thing crosses your mind. You try to reason with yourself ‘what’s the point going on anymore’ You feel as if you can’t find your silver lining, but then one day it gets easier,it feels less painful, you notice the brighter parts of life. You feel lighter as the heaviness is released from you. It seems hard to imagine the change but you would quite embrace it. You smile for yourself now not to please anyone else. You learn that this life isn’t an easy journey but a beautiful one. Don’t give up on yourself.  It gets better, I promise you it will.

-Kari :)

Perspective is the way we looks the things in general. Perspective usually entails norms and expectations. All of these aspects aid in shaping our perspectives since we usually tend to cling to them and base our lives around them. However, although this is an important part in developing a perspective on life we must not let it control out perspective because then we will be giving it power to control out lives. This is because the way we view a situation has the power to control what we see. When we develop a perspective, we tend to stick to this perspective for as long as we can because we need to be in some form of control and be able to interpret situations with information we already know. However, sometimes we hold on to that perspective so much that we end up having a ‘one-way’ outlook on life.

The situations we find ourselves in or our issues then to relate back to the perspective we hold. We when look at things in a particular way or through a particular lens we will only ever see it that way. But if you want things to change, you must change the way you look at things. Change how you think; have a different frame of mind or look at the situation from a different point of view. You may be surprised that you see an entirely new picture!

For example: if you continue to look at a cloudy day as gloomy and dull you will begin to feel gloomy and dull whenever it is cloudy. You can choose to view a cloudy day as such and be dull for the rest of the day or you can view a cloudy day as a day where the air is cool and the sun is not beating down on your face and rain is about to fall and you will be given water and sustenance! The wells will be filled, the plants will be watered and the place will become cool!

So you can choose to view things as you usually do and see things as you usually do. But if you want a change of the things you see, then change the way you see things! Choose well :D :D

If you don’t like the life then make a different choice. Make the choice that will give you the live you want and make better choices. Every choice you make will affect your life. Even tiny choices such as in the way you look at things. Make a better choice today. :)

Unity. One of the major problems of today’s society is that we focus our attention on being divided. Back in the days of slavery, the slave masters were the ones who forced division amoung the people! The European slave masters used to try their best to prevent co-operation and interaction amoung the people. They used to fill the enslaved’s minds with lies and slanders about each other and used to separate the ethnic groups. In many societies they separated the ethnic and racial groups so much that one group was located on one side of the country and the other was located on the other side of the country. And the slave masters filled the different groups of people’s minds with lies and they fabrications about the other groups! Why? Because they had one fear. One fear that could disrupt the entire system they implemented to gain power. That one fear was unity. They used to try their best to prevent the people from interacting and they filled their minds with lies so that they would hate each other so that they would never unite. They feared that when the people united they would be able to overthrow the system and defeat the heartless slave masters. They feared that they would have lost their power and the people would become free.

But today we do not need cruel European slave masters to instigate hate in us to prevent us from uniting. No. We do that ourselves! Today the society is still poisoned with the ideology that one group is better than the other. And this is what prevents the societies from moving foward and developing. Once we do not rid ourselves of these divisions we will never be able to achieve a greater good or development because we will always be in war!

We need to rid ourselves of pride and arrogance and look beyond our own selfish desires and see that we need to unite regardless of any differences! We need to become one! We need to work together and help each other and build each other up instead of bringing each other down! We need to stop looking down on people, criticizing and stop harming our fellow humans! We need to be develop a love so strong that when one person hurts, we all hurts and when one person feels joy, we all feel joy for that person instead jealousy! When one person needs help, we need to all pitch in and help! When one person is suffering, we must all act together to stop the suffering.

We are one people. One war. One love. One ummah.

**That prophet (peace be upon him) is quoted to have said: “The Believers, in their mutual love, mercy and compassion, are like one body: if one organ complained, the rest of the body develops a fever.” [Bukhari & Muslim]**

There are so many things we all plan to do. So many things we think about doing and so many things we wish we could do or be. But somehow we just never get around to doing them. Heres a step by step plan to achieve whatever you want to achieve. NOTE: I did not make this up, I found it on the net and found it to be very effective on the way to actually starting and accomplishing your goals.

1. Take a book.
2. Write down what you want to achieve in next 3 months.
3. Write down how much time you can give to this effort daily.
4. Write down what might distract you from this endeavor.
5. Cut down this BIG GOAL of 3 months into WEEKLY GOALS that will help you achieve this BIG GOAL.
6. Write down “excuses” you have been making.

Your goals can range from:
Starting school
Saving money
Reading 3 books
Writing a book
Starting a business
Memorizing Qur’an
Passing exams
Learning tajweed
Learning a new language
Learning something new
Develop a schedule (daily routine, sleep schedule etc)
De-cluttering your house
Cleaning you house or bedroom
Re-decorating you house or office
Getting promoted
Being employee of the month
Learning to sew
Purchasing a house
Moving to a new house or country
Travelling the world
Making Hajj
Praying on time
Getting closer to God
Inventing something
Getting married
Learning to cook
Purchasing a car

Or ANYTHING else you would like accomplish.

What do you want to accomplish that you haven’t started or think you can’t accomplish ? Or what have you started but haven’t accomplished as yet? I’m excited to know :D Lemme know in the comments!! Envy is a feeling of discontented or resentful longing aroused by someone else’s possessions, qualities, or luck. 

Envy is a sickness. It is a disease. It is something that has the power to snatch our happiness from us at any time and replace it with feelings of discomfort. Envy is selfish and it makes us feel as though we are not enough and we not nothing compared what others are and we need to become like them. It makes us want to be like others or even better than others. It does not satisfy us in any way but instead it leaves a longing and a feeling of deep dissatisfaction; we feel an emptiness that can only be filled by gaining the blessings that which others possess. 

Many times when we see people displaying their blessings openly we begin to feel as though we are unfortunate and unlucky. It seems as though we are on the side with the dried up, brown grass in the garden. But being to pursue the riches of this life to defeat that feeling and we chase it so much that we lose everything along the way. We lose our family, friends and time. With the loss of these aspects in life, love will no longer be a part of our lives. Then very soon our happiness will be at bay and replaced with misery. We feel miserable  every time we see someone with something that we do not own or cannot afford. We realize how impoverished we are and we notice every fault in the things we own. Nothing we own becomes enough anymore. But have we stopped to think that the grass may be greener on the other side because we look at it with envy?? These feelings we feel are results of envy?? 

Every time we feel jealous of someone else’s blessings, we become dissatisfied with what we own and discontent. We lose our minds of the desire to have what ours have. Do not succumb to envy!! Do not let this disease possess you. You are more fortunate that many of the people in this world! You do not need the things others have; do not let yourself be deceived by the life of this world. Do not lose yourself in the process of gaining what others have because you do not like what you own. Be content with what you own. Be satisfied with your own belongings. At the same time you should aim for a higher goal but do not let this be because you want what others have. Know the difference between envy and ambition. Be content, feel satisfied and stay happy :) :) 

Have you ever been envious of others? What did envy make you desire ? What did it make you forget about yourself? Tell me in the comments :) :) <3

The Hidden Beauty of Low Tide Times in Your Life – by Holley Gerth 

We step across rocks the color of midnight and sand that seeps between our toes. Every few minutes my beautiful friend Dee pauses and points, “Look there’s a starfish!” or “I see a crab!”

I stare into the tide pools to discover a world all its own. Starfish the colors of sunset. Sea anemones opening up to wave their tiny fingers as if saying hello. Hermit crabs scuttling across the ocean floor on missions known only to them.

All of this exists all the time.

But we only see it at low tide.

I think of low tide times in my life–moments when it seemed the waves of joy were swept out to sea. I felt exposed, vulnerable, as if everyone could peer inside my heart and see exactly what was there. And I always assumed it was not beautiful.

But what if that isn’t true at all? What if in the moments of “low tide” in our lives our strength and faith becomes most visible in us?

Dare to let someone look into your heart and see hope stretching out like starfish, sticky sides refusing to let go or give up.

Dare to let someone watch the closed spaces within you open in new ways that make everyone around you braver too–even if they never say so.

Dare to let someone catch a glimpse of your mission in this world and how small, awkward steps can lead to big, glorious things.

Yes, of course we want our hearts to stay hidden. We don’t like feeling exposed. We’re human, after all. But that is not how we live. We’re meant for a rhythm–a going out and coming in, filling and emptying, low and high tide. Joy and sorrow.

Hours later I stand at the edge of the beach and watch the waves crash. The space where I walked earlier has become invisible. But I know it’s there. When I close my eyes I can still picture it. It changes how I think of the ocean. It changes how I think of myself.

Don’t be afraid of low tide, my friend. It will not last forever. And the parts of your heart you’re afraid of having others see are more beautiful and full of wild grace than you can even imagine. While you sometimes wonder if you’re doing okay, the world just might be watching in wonder.

You are not what happened to you in the past. You do not have to act in accordance to your past. You can start over and become better.

There may have been a time in our lives that we experienced a serious traumatic event which has greatly impacted on our lives. Maybe it has affected the way we think, we act, we look at people or the things we do. Maybe it has prevented us from doing certain things we wanted to do or maybe it made us do things we didn’t want to do. But why do we let something that has happened in the past to control our future? Why do we let that one time in the past ruin our present? Why is it that we tend to feel bad about something that has happened in the past and let it prevent us from being who we really want to be? 

There are times where we will have to revisit our past and that is to make sure we do not commit the same acts again, make the mistakes again or react the way again. We should look at our past to gain a lesson from the experiences we had and then let it be. We cannot change the past but we can change the present and the future. We should not allow the past to tie us down, to haunt us so much that we fall into a depression and suffer everyday. We need to keep on going. Do not stop to stare at past; we need to keep moving. We need to believe in ourselves and all that we are, accept what has happened in the past and move forward. 

We are not what happened to us in the past. We are now, we are this moment. What will we do with it? What will we choose to become?

 

If you know anyone struggling with something that has occurred in the past, please share this with them. Try to show them that they do not need to struggle with their past. Are you struggling or have you struggled with something that has happened in the past? You can share your experiences in the comments :) It might help someone who is experiencing similar issues :) :)

Many times in life we find ourselves blaming other people for the issues in our own lives. We deny responsibility for what happened and try to shove all of the blame on someone else. We do this because we do not want to feel guilty, or feel bad for what happened. Every thing that goes ‘wrong’ in our lives, we say that it was the cause of someone else. But by doing this, we are actually giving someone else power over us. By saying that someone else is the cause of something that happened to us, we are giving them the power to create problems in our lives and we are giving them the ability to cause confusion, disruption and chaos in our lives. 

When we put the blame on someone else, we are actually causing more harm to ourselves. We are giving them the power to control situations in our lives and we are denying ourselves the ability to handle any situation that comes to us. When we say that we failed that test because of John, we are saying that John has the power over us to make us fail a test.( no offence to any Johns out there, just an example!) 

So instead of putting all the blame on someone else, try taking some responsibility for the things that happen in your life. I am not saying blame yourself for every thing, I am saying that it is time we all grow up and stop giving people the power to control our lives. I only take one person to change your and it is you. you are the only one who has the ability to control where you go from here and you are the only one that can control your happiness. 

 

Do you find yourself blaming others people for something that occurred in your life? What have you blamed people for? Let us know in the comments :) :)
