So summer has ended and it’s that time of the year again. The time where we must return to the institutions from hell!!! Just kidding! Going back to school or starting school doesn’t have to be stressful at all! It can actually be fun and exciting! Well I’m done with school for now; first September in 16 years I’m not going back to school!! WOOHOOOOO!!!! *Ahem* As I was saying, I have used my experience, lessons and knowledge about school to compile a list of tips for going back to or starting school. Leggo. (for those who don’t know, leggo is slang for let’s go.)

1) Buy USED textbooks – You would not believe how important this is. Why buy brand new textbooks for hundreds of dollars when you can buy a used version of the same book for half or three quarter of the price? The only difference is the price! Ain’t nobody care if your books new or old!! You may even get side notes or answers or highlights in the used one! You will save sooooo much money, I am not lying!! 

2)Wear Simple Clothes, Shoes, Hairstyles etc – Dressing up for school is utterly SENSELESS!!! It is a complete waste of time, money and effort! When you get all dressed up for school, then going to other places such as parties or the mall or to dinner with the family you will look the same!! Honestly the best thing is to dress simply for school so when you go out you will look different, and nicer! Don’t go wearing your most expensive clothes , highest heels and fanciest hairstyles to school! Wear them to go out. To school you can wear a simple jeans and t shirt with a simple ponytail and flats. As for makeup, you should only wear lip balm to keep your lips moist. Trust me, it is sooo much less to worry about when you dress simply; you don’t run out of clothes, you don’t need too much effort in choosing an outfit and you don’t need to get new clothes too often! Comment if you would like a post on simple outfit ideas for school. 

3) Carry Lunch, Snacks and Water - Carrying lunch, snacks and water can save you a ton load of money. Do a budget for the amount of money you would spend on these in school throughout the month and realize how much you can save!! Comment below if you would like a post on simple lunches for school.

4) Plan your Day and Night - making a schedule for your days and nights can help you stay on track, remember what you have to do and stay focused. Just make sure you follow the schedule! It’s easy, plan the main things you have to do, put in some time for smaller tasks such as eating, bathing etc and leave some free time for random stuff and emergencies. What a post on how to make a practical schedule? Lemme know below. 

5) Have All Books and Stationery Organized - Having a place for everything and keeping them neat and tidy ensures that you know where everything is! You will be able to find them soon; you will not lose them. If you have to hurry in the morning or night or find a book soon to complete work, you will know where to look because everything is organized! It prevents a lot of stress and worrying since you would not have to worry over losing your stuff or not being able to find it. Also if you are short on time you can find them quickly! 

6)Pack your Bag the Night Before – this tip is very useful as it prevents delays and keep backs in the morning. If you have to catch the school bus early or get dropped early then you won’t have to worry about packing your bag because it is already packed! Take 5 -10 minutes before you sleep every night and pack your bag for the next day. It is very practical and helpful! If you want a post on what to put in your bag/what’s in my schoolbag, comment below and tell me. 

 

So those are some short tips for going back to school. Lemme know how they work for you and any other tip you may have, feel free to state in the comments! It may help someone! When are you going back to school?? :) :)

Happiness doesn’t depend on any external condition, it is governed by our own mental attitude. 

Most people wouldn’t believe me when I say this, but you can control your own happiness. You can actually CHOOSE to be happy and not to be happy. We may not realize it but most of the times where we feel frustrated, sad, depressed, and angry, we are the instigators of it. Due to some choice WE made, we can experience those feelings. It may sound like a bunch of happy go lucky bull, but the reality is that we are ones who bring distress upon our selves and we can also bring happiness upon ourselves if try. 

Being happy, peaceful, and calm does not have to depend on your relationship, job, school, people or money. It starts with YOU. Only you! Only you can control how to react to situations, only you can choose not to get angry, only you can choose to enjoy simple things in life, only you can choose to smile every morning. 

I know sometimes people may hurt our feelings and things will happen that will make us sad, but permanent sadness is something brought on by ourselves. We are the ones who choose to worry about everything, fuss about small things, not smile everyday, criticize everything and this in turn brings on a wave of depression or sadness. It is controlled solely by you. If you want you can choose to change your attitude, to find things everyday that make you happy. You can dig out the simple things that we should be grateful for. 

Most of times if you have undergone a long period of sadness, grief, heartaches, depression, stress, hate, frustration, distress, despair and anger, you will have a harder time finding things to be happy for and have a harder time changing your mental attitude. But you have to dig deep and search. It will be above all of the distress and buried deep in the little things in life. You have to rise above the pain to find it. 

So today I challenge you to a step in changing your life. Everyday, try a little to change your mindset and adopt a more positive mindset rather than negative. Here’s one way how: For every bad thought, think three positive and happy thoughts. You can also list things during the day that made you happy; list no less than 3. You can also take part in our gratitude challenge. 

Are you letting your happiness be determined by external conditions? How are you gonna change that?? Tell me in the comments! I’m interested in knowing your own ways!! :D :D :D

Happy Independence Trinidad and Tobago!

52 years ago, on this day (31s August), this beautiful country achieved independence from being owned and controlled by the ruling system and Queen of England. Due to the colonization of the region by the Europeans, and the slavery system that the Africans suffered, and the indentureship that the East Indians, Syrians, Chinese, and Lebanese suffered, the country is now occupied by people of multiple races and religions. In the islands of Trinidad and Tobago we have Africans, East Indians, French, Spanish, English, Chinese, Syrians, Lebanese, Arabs, Dutch and many more including interracial and mixed people. 

So enjoy your indepedence T&T and remember your ancestors that fought day and night and suffered tremendous torture for the land we live in today. Don’t take for granted the freedom that was fought for by those before you. 

Take a look at these pics of the beautiful islands of Trinbago. Sweet sweet T&T.

Michelle Marie at http://michelemarie33.wordpress.com/ requested that I post the recipe for fried aloo (potato). This is a Caribbean dish. It stemmed from an Indian dish but with some Caribbean flavours and twists. And let me tell you, it is delicious! It’s actually one of my favourites.

 

This can be eaten with roti or rice! Also, this dish is completely Halaal!

Fried Aloo 

Ingredients

4 Potatoes
Garlic
Onion
Tomatoes
Chadon Beni (also called culantro)
Pimento peppers
2 Tablespoons oil
1 Tablespoon salt
Black pepper
1/2 Cup water

Directions

1) Dice up potatoes into thin, small and equal slices.
2) Chop garlic, onion, pimentos and chadon beni.
3) Hot oil in pot.
4) Add seasoning to the chopped garlic, onion, pimentos and chadon beni and let saute for a few minutes.
5)Add potatoes
6) Turn down stove and cover pot and let cook.
7) Add salt and black pepper.
8) Add water and allow to cook until tender.
* Stir potatoes often to avoid sticking, you can also add a little water.

Now this dish has a lot of spices because the Caribbean goodness! You can tweek to your taste and remove of add spices but the seasoning and spices are for taste!

If you try this please let me know how it comes out :) Have you ever tasted any Caribbean food?? How did it taste? Did you like it?? :) I’m super excited to know! Comment and tell me!! You should also check out and follow Michelle’s blog, it’s great! :D :D

Do you know how it feels to let go of someone you love so they could be happy? It’s a horrible feeling. Many times in life we will have to fight for something we love. Where it is a person or an item or a dream, it is a painful situation to be in. Not knowing if to give up or to continue trying. That is one of life’s trickiest and hardest tests. How do you know if you are making the right decision? You never really know until you make the decision. Sometimes you need to take the chance and continue trying. But there are also times where you must give up. No not give up, stop trying. It’s not so much giving up as it is letting go. Letting go is not the same thing as giving up, it’s taking it to a higher level. Knowing that the person you love does not and will not love you is heart wrenching and horrifyingly painful but that is how you know that letting go of that person is the right choice. If you are truly in love with the person, you will consider their needs before yours. You will love them no matter what. You will do your best just to make them happy and if it does not include you well then so be it!

Why do we get depressed and angry with someone when they don’t love us back? Why do we feel as though we must make them like us and force ourselves onto them? Why do feel like we need to break up their current relationships so we could be with them? It’s selfish. Love is not selfish but sometimes it makes people do selfish things.  If the person is happy with someone else then we need to leave it as it is. Interfering with their lives and messing it up so we could get our way, or hating their partner to express our pain is only going to do more harm. We will be hurting the person we love and if it is truly love it should feel worse that hurting ourselves. If you really love this person, you need to accept who they are and if they have a happy home with a wife or husband and kids then you need to leave it alone. If the person finds love somewhere else and is in a relationship or is not looking for a relationship at the moment then you need to leave that alone. Let them think for themselves. Let them decide if they love you or not, let them decide if they will be happier with a change, let them decide if they want a different partner.  Choosing to let go can be the harder of the two choices but if it must be done then allow it to be done. Allow the person you love to feel love and experience its wonders.  Let them experience true happiness and bliss. Even if it means the person you love marrying someone else and then having kids and living a lifetime without you, then allow it if it means they will be happy and delighted.

Sometimes we have to fight for what we love and care about but sometimes we need to find the strength to let go.  If you truly love someone you’ll want them to be happy even if it’s not with you.

Today (26th September) is Mesothelioma Awareness Day and someone requested that I post on mesothelioma. She was a victim of this disease and she shared with me some of her painful experiences in suffering with this disease. So I did a bit of research to find out more about this mesothelioma disease and it really is something to look out for. Any innocent person can get it and it can mess up your life and the lives of your loved ones!

Ever heard of Mesothelioma? Well it’s a very rare cancer that can affect anyone and everyone. It is not due to personal lifestyle choices and habits but rather it is due to the external environment. So today I want to share some knowledge on this fatal illness.

Mesothelioma is cancer of the mesothelium, a protective membrane that lines most of the body’s internal organs. Most times the disease begins in the organs of the chest cavity such as lungs and heart but can also occur in the abdominal cavity. This disease, once planted, can spread throughout the body and infect the entire body.

Causes

One the main cause of mesothelioma is asbestos.

What are asbestos you ask? You think you are not in contact with asbestos? Well there’s a chance you are…there’s a chance we all are!
Asbestos is a naturally occurring fibrous mineral. It is fire resistant, chemical resistant and an excellent insulator hence it was added to various building material, automotive and other industries. So what’s the big deal with asbestos?? When the products containing asbestos are disturbed (broken, burnt, destroyed etc) the tiny asbestos fibres are released in the air. When inhaled, they can become trapped in the lungs for many many years! This can lead to serious health problems such as asbestosis, mesothelioma, and lung cancer.

Where can asbestos be found?

  •  Sprayed on fire proofing and insulation in buildings
  • Insulation for pipes and boilers
  • Wall and ceiling insulation
  • Ceiling tiles
  • Floor tiles
  • Putties, caulks, and cements (such as in chemical carrying cement pipes)
  • Roofing shingles
  • Siding shingles on old residential buildings
  • Wall and ceiling texture in older buildings and homes
  • Joint compound in older buildings and homes
  • Plasters
  • Brake linings and clutch pads

* this listing is not complete

Other causes of mesothelioma include: Zeolites, Radiation (exposure to high doses of radiation to the chest or abdomen or after injections of thorium dioxide (Thorotrast), a material used by doctors in some chest X-rays until the 1950s,) SV40 virus (simian virus 40) and Genetics.

Symptoms

The main symptoms of mesothelioma of the lungs are shortness of breath and chest pain.

Symptoms of abdominal mesothelioma can include:

  • Weight loss
  • Swelling and pain in the abdomen
  • Blood clotting abnormalities
  • Bowel obstruction
  • Anemia
  • Fever

If cancer has spread to other parts of the body, symptoms may include pain, swallowing difficulties, or swelling of the neck or face.

Since these symptoms are common conditions of other diseases, you should contact your local health physician first before you come to conclusions by yourself.

Prevention

Since asbestos is the biggest risk factor of mesothelioma, avoiding or limiting exposure to asbestos is the best way to prevent it.
People who might be exposed to high levels of asbestos at work include some miners, factory workers, insulation manufacturers and installers, railroad and automotive workers, ship builders, gas mask manufacturers, and construction workers. Wearing protective gear is way to avoid it. Washing the equipment and clothing and other items used around asbestos is another way to avoid contact.
Older homes may have insulation containing asbestos or other materials. A knowledgeable person in the field should be able to check your home or building for asbestos and they can get rid of it. Also, you should avoid drilling or refurbishing older houses without an expert in case they may contain asbestos.

Cure

While mesothelioma may be curable in its early stages, in the later stages it is not. (According to the specialist). However there is a treatment plan which includes chemotherapy and can lead to removal of the organ. This treatment plan may extend life expectancy and provide a better quality of life.
Treating this disease is very very expensive! Mesothelioma surgery can cost around $40000 and the chemotherapy can cost around $30000. That is almost $100000. So the ultimate cure is by far, prevention!

Check yourself today to see if you are being exposed to asbestos, you DO NOT want to be a victim of mesothelioma!!

You can learn more about mesothelioma and asbestos on http://www.mesothelioma.com/

Do you know anyone who suffered this disease?? Feel free to share your experience in the comments it might be helpful to someone! Also, share this post to inform others about the dangers of asbestos and mesothelioma.

There are many traits in life we can adopt that will increase the amount of happiness we feel and give us more contentment with ourselves. Here is a list of simple virtues that can make our lives happier.

1) Patience – patience is the ability and willingness to restrain anger, annoyance, irritation and provocation. How is this a simple trait that will make you happier? Having patience ensures that you do not lose your temper easily. You do not get extremely angry and ‘cuss down’ those who angered you. It entails that you take some time to understand the situation before you react with the first thought that comes to mind. You can save lots of relationships and prevent yourself from becoming angry too often. It gives you time to calm down and breathe before dealing with the situation in an effective manner.

2) Compassion – Compassion is the feeling of empathy and understanding of someone’s misfortune, accompanied by the desire the alleviate their pain. The first steps in being compassionate is understanding the pain of others and realizing that they are suffering and need your help. The second step is to act on it and actually help. You can help in many ways such as taking action or just listening to their story. This trait will allow you to be beneficial to others by offering your support. In turn, the happiness and joy you will receive from knowing that you brightened someone’s day or removed or reduced their trouble is immensely satisfying.

3) Acceptance – Acceptance should be a part of life for everyone. This entails not judging people based on colour, size, religion, race, looks or anything at all. It is about being kind to everyone, not just those who are like you. You will meet many different people in your life in school, workplace, social gatherings, family events even, and if you choose to only associate with a certain group of people then you are limiting yourself to many things. Accepting people for who they are instead of judging them or trying to change them will increase your happiness level because you are not spending time doing negative things such as judging but you are sharing your kindness, love, care and appreciation to everyone regardless of anything they may be.

4) Forgiveness – Ever heard of the phrase ‘ forgive because you need peace not because of someone needs forgiveness’ ? Well it’s true. It is better to forgive that to waste your time being hurt, regretful and angry. Hating on someone else because of something they did to you will only consume your time and your life. You get nothing out of that. You need to forgive them so that you can move on, release the burdens and find peace. Forgiveness will definitely give you lots of peace of mind and ease. Read this for more on forgiveness http://aminellie.wordpress.com/2014/04/29/forgive-because-you-deserve-peace/ .

5) Encouragement – encouragement is is the act of giving support, confidence or hope. This simple act can do wonders to a person. Encouraging someone to fulfill a purpose, chase a dream, or even get up each day can change that person’s life forever. A simple inspirational quote or hug or smile even; this can immensely turn around someone’s day and make them feel better about themselves and realize that they are worthy. By doing this you are restoring faith and hope in that person and you will also receive satisfaction. You feel good about yourself for helping someone to pursue something or to not give up. You may even feel motivated yourself.

6) Love – Everything revolves around love. It is one of the most powerful emotions you can feel. It is important to show love to people especially you children, parents, spouse, siblings, friends and others. Showing love includes being patient, compassionate, accepting, forgiving and encouragement. Being loved makes us feel as though we are worthy, purposeful, and someone special. We should always show love to people because you never know what situation they might be in and a simple act of love can enlighten them. In showing love you get love. When you display a loving character you will seem approachable and friendly so you will not be shunned or hated on. Loving the people around you will get you a lifetime of happiness , peace and joy.Tell the people you love that you love them often, and let them know that you appreciate them. Just as you want to be loved, so do other people; so do your kids, your spouse, your parents, your friends, random person on the street, wheelchair guy, that creepy dude in work. Show them you love them and let the joy you get from the satisfaction you get from brightening someone’s day bring you happiness.

These tips may sound difficult to adopt but to key is trying them one at a time. Try the one you find simplest first and take it in baby steps. It mightn’t happen today or tomorrow but keep trying until you fully understand these virtues and adopt them in your life. :) :)

What virtues do you have that will make life happier?? Share in the comments!! :D

Too many times we are faced with decisions that we think will entirely change us. The truth is, we are so caught up in wanting everything to be perfect that our paranoia gets to us. We feel so entirely messed up and stuck between what we want and what we think is right. I simply want to tell you that you should be honest to yourself. Don’t pretend to be okay if the truth of the matter is that you’re not. Nothing in this life will be perfect and every good thing will come with trials. It’s okay to be defeated but it’s how you handle the aftermath that really matters. Don’t let things make you feel invincible. After the storm comes the rainbow not the end of the world. Be strong!

-Kari
